update.description:
The main feature of this pull request is a fix for bullet's revolute joint (BulletHingeJoint) so that it passes the same pendulum test as ODE (SimplePendulumTest). I did have to tweak the inertial parameters slightly in simple_pendulums_bullet.world, changing inertia values from 0 to 1e-6, so it does differ insubstantially from the ODE test.

I also made a few static functions in BulletTypes for converting between gazebo and bullet Vector3 and poses.

I filled in the BulletLink::OnPoseChange, so that Reset Model Poses, Reset World, and the move/rotate tools work.

I fixed a bug in the processing of physics messages, so the update rate, step size, and gravity can be adjusted from the gui.

I also added Link::GetWorldCoGPose, which is useful since the bullet functions define everything relative to the center of gravity of a rigid body.

I also added a SpawnDropCoG test, which spawns several spheres of different radii and different center of gravity locations. It's currently failing; I believe it is related to physics engine parameters, which will be addressed in a future pull request. I've added the failing tests to the description of issue #349.

UPDATE:
Ian figured out what was causing the SpawnDrop tests to fail, so now there is only one portion of the tests that fails, related to issue #376.
update.title: Bullet integration: simple pendulum
